item.title: Judge: Anthropic’s $1.5B settlement is being shoved “down the throat of authors”
item.description: Feeling “misled,” judge refuses to rubber-stamp Anthropic’s proposed settlement.

item.title: Piracy in Brazil: Film, TV Industry to Discuss at Expocine New Ways Forward to Curb Digital Piracy

item.title: “First of its kind” AI settlement: Anthropic to pay authors $1.5 billion
item.description: Settlement shows AI companies can face consequences for pirated training data.

item.title: Sting operation kills “copycat” sports piracy site with 1.6B visits last year
item.description: Original Streameast pirating site was taken down before but remains accesible today.

item.title: Sports streaming hub Streameast ‘shut down’ in sting
item.description: Streameast, one of the largest sports piracy platforms in the world, has been shut down according to the Alliance for Creativity and Entertainment (ACE), an antipiracy group that counts NBC Universal,

item.title: Authors celebrate “historic” settlement coming soon in Anthropic class action
item.description: Advocates fear such settlements will “financially ruin” the AI industry.
